original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la zil gyis gnon par sems pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims spong bar bgyi bar sems pa lags so //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la zil gyis gnon par sems pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims spong bar bgyi bar sems pa lags so //
translated: those who think to surpass the bodhisattva’s discipline are thinking to abandon the discipline of the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshul khrims ni zil gyis mi non pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi tshul khrims ni zil gyis mi non pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because the discipline of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is unsurpassed.”

original: @70a *// de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: @70a *// de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang ldog pa de'i tshul khrims kyang zil gyis mi non pa yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang ldog pa de'i tshul khrims kyang zil gyis mi non pa yin nam /
translated: is the morality of a bodhisattva who turns back also not overcome?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: He replied: “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sems la gnas pa ni phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sems la gnas pa ni phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: a bodhisattva who abides in the mind of awakening does not turn back.

original: gang phyir ldog pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang phyir ldog pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang mi bya'o //
translated: One who turns back is not called a bodhisattva.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / gal te 'phong gi slob dpon gyi mnga' gzas pa bzhin mi 'gro na de 'phong gi slob dpon zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / gal te 'phong gi slob dpon gyi mnga' gzas pa bzhin mi 'gro na de 'phong gi slob dpon zhes mi bya'o //
translated: for example, if one does not go as far as the master of archery aims, one is not called a master of archery.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du gal te byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi ldan pa 'byung ngam /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi ldan pa 'byung ngam /
translated: In the same way, if the thoughts and mental states of a bodhisattva do not have omniscience,

original: yang na sbyin pa byin nam /
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa byin nam /
translated: or if he gives a gift,

original: tshul khrims srung ngam /🔽bzod pa sgrub bam /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ngam / bzod pa sgrub bam /
translated: or if he guards morality,🔽or if he achieves patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mam /
translated: or if he undertakes perseverance,

original: bsam gtan rnams la mnyam par 'jog gam /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la mnyam par 'jog gam /
translated: or if he becomes absorbed in meditative absorption,

original: shes rab sgom yang rung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo na byang chub sems dpa' de tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab sgom yang rung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo na byang chub sems dpa' de tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: or if he cultivates wisdom, but does not dedicate it to omniscience, then that bodhisattva is not called ‘one who is endowed with morality.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba'ang mi shes la nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / gal te byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ji ltar yongs su bsngo ba'ang mi shes la nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi @70b sar yang yongs su sngo bar mi byed na yongs su bsngo ba med du zin kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi @70b sar yang yongs su sngo bar mi byed na yongs su bsngo ba med du zin kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: if a bodhisattva does not know how to dedicate to omniscience, and does not dedicate to the level of a śrāvaka or the level of a pratyekabuddha, then, even though he does not dedicate, he is called ‘one who is endowed with morality.’

original: yongs su bsngo bar byed na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar byed na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: If they dedicate it, then the bodhisattva mahāsattva takes up the perfection of correct morality.

original: 'on kyang tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: However, Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gcig ni yun ring mo zhig nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur la gcig shos ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcig ni yun ring mo zhig nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur la gcig shos ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening after a long time, and the other🔽will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening quickly,

original: thabs la mkhas pas myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: that is, through skillful means.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas par yun ring mo zhig nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ni sla'i //🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas par yun ring mo zhig nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ni sla'i // nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: it is easy for a bodhisattva who is not skilled in means to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening after a long time,🔽but it is not easy to fall to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: or to the pratyekabuddha level.

original: mi zhig chom rkun gyi yang ba nas mchis te 'ongs pa ni sla'i //
analyzed: mi zhig chom rkun gyi yang ba nas mchis te 'ongs pa ni sla'i //
translated: It is easy for a man who has been captured by bandits to escape from them,

original: bcom ste myur du 'ongs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ste myur du 'ongs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but it is not easy for him to escape quickly.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du ring mo zhig nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni sla'i /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du ring mo zhig nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni sla'i / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: it is easy to attain complete buddhahood after a long time.🔽But it is not so easy to fall into the stage of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: or the stage of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, bodhisattva great beings who are skilled in means and who wish to quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should know that there are two ways.

original: yang na ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Either they will manifest the very limit of reality,

original: yang na ni @71a *//
analyzed: yang na ni @71a *//
translated: Or else,🔽

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / khyim zhig 'tshig la khyim 'tshig pa de'i nang na rin po che'i phung po 'dug ste /
analyzed: dper na / khyim zhig 'tshig la khyim 'tshig pa de'i nang na rin po che'i phung po 'dug ste /
translated: it is like this: if a house is burning, and in that burning house there is a heap of jewels,

original: rin po che 'dod pa'i mi la la zhig khyim der zhugs na des rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rin po che 'dod pa'i mi la la zhig khyim der zhugs na des rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
translated: If a person who desires jewels were to enter that house, one should know that he will have two results.

original: yang na ni khyim de'i nang du 'tshig par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na ni khyim de'i nang du 'tshig par 'gyur /
translated: Either he will be burned by the fire in that house,

original: yang na ni rin po che de dag khyer te 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni rin po che de dag khyer te 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or he will come out carrying the jewels.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
translated: in the same way, one should know that a bodhisattva who is skilled in means and who wishes to quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment will have two results.

original: yang na ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur /
translated: Either he will actualize the limit of reality,

original: yang na ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or he will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa de thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa de thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya'am /
translated: “Is it the case that a bodhisattva who realizes the limit of reality is skilled in means?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po byang chub sems dpa' gang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa de ni thabs mkhas pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po byang chub sems dpa' gang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa de ni thabs mkhas pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa, a bodhisattva who realizes the limit of reality is not skilled in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: rang @71b sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it is not the case that a bodhisattva who has fallen to the level of a śrāvaka or the level of a pratyekabuddha is skilled in means.

original: de ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: de ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro // tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: That is the outcome of a lack of skill in means.🔽Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu spyod pa na bdag ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu spyod pa na bdag ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: if a bodhisattva who is practicing for awakening thinks, ‘I will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag ni ma yin no snyam du rnam par rtog na de spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
translated: If one thinks in this way, one is practicing in a domain that is not the domain.

original: gang spyod yul ma yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: gang spyod yul ma yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon yin no //
translated: That which is not the domain is a fault of morality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag ni sbyin pa ches mang ba byin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag ni sbyin pa ches mang ba byin pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if a bodhisattva thinks, “I give more gifts than others,

analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims srung ba'o // bdag ni bzod pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: I guard morality,🔽I am patient,

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: I am energetic,

original: bdag ni bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: I am concentrated,

original: bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin gyi /
translated: I practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag ni ma yin no snyam du de ltar rnam par rtog na'ang spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag ni ma yin no snyam du de ltar rnam par rtog na'ang spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
translated: while other bodhisattvas do not do so,” if one conceptualizes in this way, one is practicing in a domain that is not the domain.

original: spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon yin no //
translated: That which is not the domain is a fault of morality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag ni ji ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i thabs shes kyi byang chub sems dpa' @72a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag ni ji ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i yongs su bsngo ba'i thabs shes kyi byang chub sems dpa' @72a *//
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan dag ni de ltar mi shes so snyam du sems na'ang spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar mi shes so snyam du sems na'ang spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Pūrṇa, if a bodhisattva were to think, “I know the method of dedication by which one dedicates merit, but other bodhisattvas do not know it,” then he would be engaging in what is not the domain [of a bodhisattva],

original: spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon no //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon no //
translated: and that which is not the domain [of a bodhisattva] is a fault in his morality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du 'dug la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du 'dug la /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i kha zas sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'ang bsod snyoms gcig dang / sems bskyed pa gcig gis zil gyis mnan par bya'o snyam du sems na spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i kha zas sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'ang bsod snyoms gcig dang / sems bskyed pa gcig gis zil gyis mnan par bya'o snyam du sems na spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod de /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Pūrṇa, if a bodhisattva were to think, “I will make other bodhisattvas sit for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river and give them the food of a universal monarch, but I will surpass them with a single act of generosity and a single thought of awakening,” then he would be engaging in what is not the domain [of a bodhisattva],🔽and that which is not the domain [of a bodhisattva] is a fault in his morality.

original: spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon yin te /
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi skyon yin te /
translated: That which is not the domain of the śrāvakas is the fault of that bodhisattva’s moral discipline.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni thabs la mkhas pa yin du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa 'di ji ltar rnam par rtog na de thabs la mkhas pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni thabs la mkhas pa yin du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa 'di ji ltar rnam par rtog na de thabs la mkhas pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Even if a bodhisattva is skilled in means, if he thinks in this way, he is not called skilled in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa' dang mi mthun par mi bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa' dang mi mthun par mi bya /
translated: A bodhisattva should not oppose another bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa' la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa' la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
translated: A bodhisattva should not despise another bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa' la brnyas par mi bya yi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni byang chub sems dpa' la brnyas par mi bya yi /
translated: A bodhisattva should not look down on another bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gus par rim gro bya ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gus par rim gro bya ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a bodhisattva should arouse devotion toward another bodhisattva as if it were toward the Tathāgata himself.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ci byang chub sems @72b dpa' 'ba' zhig la gus par rim gror bya yi /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems @72b dpa' 'ba' zhig la gus par rim gror bya yi /
translated: “But is it only the Bodhisattvas who are to be honored and served?

original: sems can gzhan dag la ni gus par rim gro mi bya'am /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la ni gus par rim gro mi bya'am /
translated: Or should one also honor and serve other sentient beings?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: sems can thams cad la'ang ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la gus par rim gro bya ba bzhin du gus pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la'ang ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la gus par rim gro bya ba bzhin du gus pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: one should honor and serve all sentient beings as one honors and serves the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' mthong na gus par rim gro bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' mthong na gus par rim gro bya'o //
translated: In the same way, when a Bodhisattva sees another Bodhisattva, he should honor and serve him.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams mthong na'ang gus par rim gro bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams mthong na'ang gus par rim gro bya'o //
translated: In the same way, when he sees fellow practitioners of the Way, he should honor and serve them.

original: de bzhin du sems can gzhan dag la'ang gus par rim gro bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gzhan dag la'ang gus par rim gro bya'o //
translated: In the same way, he should honor and serve other sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas dma' ba'i sems dang / gus pa dang bcas pa dang / zhes dang bcas par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas dma' ba'i sems dang / gus pa dang bcas pa dang / zhes dang bcas par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, a Bodhisattva should have a humble mind, a respectful mind, and a reverential mind.

original: nga rgyal spangs pas gus par rim gro bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal spangs pas gus par rim gro bya'o //
translated: He should honor and serve them, having abandoned pride.

original: 'di ltar yang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can 'di dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can 'di dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood and lead these beings to complete nirvāṇa.🔽I will teach the Dharma in order to eliminate the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir chos kyang bstan par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing de ltar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir chos kyang bstan par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing de ltar bsam par bya'o //
translated: In this way, you should generate bodhicitta and think in this way.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams la dma' ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams la dma' ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: in this way, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should have a humble attitude toward sentient beings.

original: byams pa'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems su bya'o //
translated: They should have a loving attitude.

original: sems can de dag gi mchog tu 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi mchog tu 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: They should be the best among those sentient beings.

original: mchog kyang byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog kyang byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: They should also cause others to be the best.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mchog nyid ni @73a *//
analyzed: mchog nyid ni @73a *//
translated: Because the best

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is this:

original: sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: buddhahood.

original: 'di ltar 'di la byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad la'ang byams pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad la'ang byams pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas should generate love for all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi bdag po la bdag po byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi bdag po la bdag po byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: They should also make all sentient beings the masters of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Morality

original: le'u bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Four

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the Venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi bdag por mchog byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi bdag por mchog byed du 'jug ste /
translated: when bodhisattvas fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, do they make all sentient beings the supreme masters of the Dharma,

original: 'doms shing rjes su ston par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'doms shing rjes su ston par 'gyur ram /
translated: and instruct and teach them?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pas dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pas dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba mngon par sprul te /
translated: For example, a skilled magician’s apprentice conjures up an army with four divisions.

original: rgyal po dang bcas pa'i sde mngon par sprul na /
analyzed: rgyal po dang bcas pa'i sde mngon par sprul na /
translated: Having conjured up the army, he also conjures up a king.

original: ci sgyu ma'i mi de dag 'di snyam du gang bdag cag la dbang byed pa'i rgyal po ni yod do snyam du sems sam /🔽smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ci sgyu ma'i mi de dag 'di snyam du gang bdag cag la dbang byed pa'i rgyal po ni yod do snyam du sems sam / smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Do those illusory people think, ‘There is a king who rules over us’?🔽”

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, they do not.”

original: smras pa / ci rgyal po de 'di snyam du bdag gi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di dag ni yod do snyam du sems sam /🔽smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: smras pa / ci rgyal po de 'di snyam du bdag gi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di dag ni yod do snyam du sems sam / smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: “Do you think, ‘There is this army with four divisions’?🔽”

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, they do not.”

original: smras pa / dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa de dag thams cad ni rjes @73b su gtogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa / dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa de dag thams cad ni rjes @73b su gtogs pa ma yin /
translated: “That entire army with four divisions does not belong to the past,

original: dngos por gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos por gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: does not belong to the future,🔽and does not belong to the present.

original: rdzas ma yin par gtogs pa /
analyzed: rdzas ma yin par gtogs pa /
translated: It does not belong to a substance,🔽and it does not belong to a non-substance.

original: dngos po ma yin par gtogs pa yin pas de dag la bdag po byed du 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin par gtogs pa yin pas de dag la bdag po byed du 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it is not a lord that makes them act.

original: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na ji ltar de dag mchog byed du 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na ji ltar de dag mchog byed du 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: The Lord has said that all phenomena are like an illusion. How can you make them supreme?

original: byang chub sems dpas gang dag mchog byed du gzhug par bya ba'i chos rnams ni gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gang dag mchog byed du gzhug par bya ba'i chos rnams ni gang yin /
translated: What are the phenomena that the bodhisattva should make supreme?

original: gang mchog byed du 'jug pa'i chos de ni gang yin /
analyzed: gang mchog byed du 'jug pa'i chos de ni gang yin /
translated: What is the phenomenon that makes them supreme?

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpas chos 'ga' zhig yang dag par rjes su mthong na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpas chos 'ga' zhig yang dag par rjes su mthong na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: if the bodhisattva were to see any phenomenon, he would not be practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi tshe chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: When he does not see any phenomenon at all,

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin te /
translated: then the bodhisattva is not separate from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva’s skill in means.”

original: chos gang mchog byed du 'jug pa'i chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong la /
analyzed: chos gang mchog byed du 'jug pa'i chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong la /
translated: He does not see any dharma that is supreme, nor does he see any dharma that is not supreme.

original: de las kyang phyir mi ldog par de nyid ni de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang phyir mi ldog par de nyid ni de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: And he does not turn back from that. That is his perfection of effort.

original: gang sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams kyi bdag por nye bar gnas la de las kyang phyir mi ldog pa dang / btsal ba'ang 'bras bu dang bcas par mthong la chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba bzhin du /🔽de las kyang phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub @74a *//
analyzed: gang sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams kyi bdag por nye bar gnas la de las kyang phyir mi ldog pa dang / btsal ba'ang 'bras bu dang bcas par mthong la chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba bzhin du / de las kyang phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub @74a *//
translated: He abides as the lord of illusory dharmas, and he does not turn back from that. He sees that his search is fruitful, and he does not see any dharma at all.

original: sems dpa' brtson 'grus kyi go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' brtson 'grus kyi go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And he does not turn back from that. That is the bodhisattva’s great armor of effort.

original: de ltar 'dir lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu 'jig la /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rab tu 'jig la /
translated: In that way, he is armored here in the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: 'dir 'jig pa'ang gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig pa'ang gang yang med de /
translated: And here there is no destruction at all.

original: de lta bur bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de lta bur bdag nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: In that way, he fully awakens to such a self.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob nas 'di ltar ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis zhi ba'i chos nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob nas 'di ltar ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis zhi ba'i chos nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: Having attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will explain the peaceful nature of phenomena using collections of names, collections of words, and collections of letters.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: The nature of all phenomena cannot be expressed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad ni rab tu gsal ba yin la de dag ni bsten par yang mi nus so //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad ni rab tu gsal ba yin la de dag ni bsten par yang mi nus so // de la byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams la /
translated: however, all phenomena are clear, and they cannot be relied upon.🔽There, bodhisattvas, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: say to sentient beings,

original: chos nyid 'di ni rab tu gsal ba ste /
analyzed: chos nyid 'di ni rab tu gsal ba ste /
translated: ‘This nature of phenomena is clear.

original: 'di dag ni nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa ma yin mod kyi ngas ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa ma yin mod kyi ngas ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: These were not taught by me after I fully awakened, but I taught them just as I fully awakened.’

original: 'on kyang su la'ang bstan pa med cing su la'ang bstan pa mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang su la'ang bstan pa med cing su la'ang bstan pa mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: But it is not taught to anyone, nor will it be taught to anyone.

original: de bas na 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya @74b bar 'dod pa'i sems phyir mi ldog cing zhum par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya @74b bar 'dod pa'i sems phyir mi ldog cing zhum par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment should not turn back or become discouraged.

original: brtson 'grus 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'dzin la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos na 'di ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'dzin la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos na 'di ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: If he upholds only diligence and dedicates that perfection of diligence to omniscience, that is his perfection of morality.

original: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa /
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa /
translated: That perfection of diligence dedicated to omniscience

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims yin te /
translated: is the pure morality.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: To the extent that one dedicates to omniscience, to that extent the bodhisattva’s morality is purified.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ji ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ji ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya /
translated: how can illusory phenomena be dedicated to omniscience?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gal te chos 'di dag sgyu ma lta bu ma yin du zin na ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar yang shin tu mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te chos 'di dag sgyu ma lta bu ma yin du zin na ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar yang shin tu mi nus te /
translated: if these phenomena were not like an illusion, then it would not be possible to dedicate them to omniscience.

original: gang gi phyir chos 'di dag sgyu ma lta bur gyur pa de'i tshe chos 'di dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar nus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos 'di dag sgyu ma lta bur gyur pa de'i tshe chos 'di dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar nus so //
translated: But because these phenomena are like an illusion, it is possible to dedicate them to omniscience.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i rtsol ba'ang mthu dang ldan pa yin zhing brtson 'grus kyang shin tu rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i rtsol ba'ang mthu dang ldan pa yin zhing brtson 'grus kyang shin tu rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva’s exertion is powerful and his effort is complete.”

original: smras pa / rtsol ba mthu dang ldan pa gang yin pa 'di gang gi gnas yin /
analyzed: smras pa / rtsol ba mthu dang ldan pa gang yin pa 'di gang gi gnas yin /
translated: “What is the basis of this powerful effort?”

original: smras pa / 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: “This is the basis of skillful means.

original: thabs la mkhas pa la brten @75a *//
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa la brten @75a *//
translated: Based on skillful means,

original: nas 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni da ltar thabs la mkhas pa la gnas so snyam du shes te /
analyzed: nas 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni da ltar thabs la mkhas pa la gnas so snyam du shes te /
translated: one should know that these phenomena are presently based on skillful means.

original: de la goms par yang mi byed /
analyzed: de la goms par yang mi byed /
translated: One should not become habituated to them,

original: yang dag pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: nor should one fall into the limit of reality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:🔽For example, a person sitting on a cliff holds an umbrella in both hands, firmly grasping it on the edge of the cliff, and with one foot steps out onto the edge of the cliff.

original: dper na / mi zhig brag gi rtse mor 'dug pas lag pa gnyis na gdugs thogs te dam du bzung nas brag de'i khar brten la rkang pa ya gcig gis nur te; g-yang sa mi bzad pa la blta na g-yang sar bzhag kyang gdugs kyis rlung thogs par byas pa'i gdugs
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig brag gi rtse mor 'dug pas lag pa gnyis na gdugs thogs te dam du bzung nas brag de'i khar brten la rkang pa ya gcig gis nur te; g-yang sa mi bzad pa la blta na g-yang sar bzhag kyang gdugs kyis rlung thogs par byas pa'i gdugs
translated: Looking down into the abyss, although he is standing on the edge of the abyss, the umbrella blocks the wind,

original: de dag dang / rlung de'i stobs kyi shugs des der ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang / rlung de'i stobs kyi shugs des der ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and by the power of the strength of the umbrella and the wind, he will not fall down there.

original: de ltar brag gi khan 'dug pa'i mi des bdag nyid g-yang sar 'dug tu zin kyang gdugs de dag gis rlung thogs par byas pa'i 'du byed kyis brten pas de g-yang sa de la'ang lta zhing der ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brag gi khan 'dug pa'i mi des bdag nyid g-yang sar 'dug tu zin kyang gdugs de dag gis rlung thogs par byas pa'i 'du byed kyis brten pas de g-yang sa de la'ang lta zhing der ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The person sitting on the cliff, although sitting on the edge of the cliff, does not fall off the cliff because the wind is held back by the parasols.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang thabs la mkhas pa la'ang brten cing snying rje chen pos kyang sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes la rnam par lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang thabs la mkhas pa la'ang brten cing snying rje chen pos kyang sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes la rnam par lta ste /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is skilled in means, relying on skill in means, with great compassion, knows and sees the illusory phenomena just as they are.

original: thabs la mkhas pa des yongs su zin pas chos de dag la goms par byed par yang mi ltung la de'i sems kyang zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa des yongs su zin pas chos de dag la goms par byed par yang mi ltung la de'i sems kyang zhum par mi 'gyur /

original: chos de dag kyang mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: He does not actualize those phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: g-yang @75b sa chen po mi bzang pa de ni /
analyzed: g-yang @75b sa chen po mi bzang pa de ni /
translated: That great, terrible cliff is

analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The direct realization of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos shing /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos shing /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is equipped with the great armor

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phung po dam pa dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and is supported by skillful means possesses the excellent aggregate of the perfection of morality.

original: gang mngon par 'du bya ba dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du bya ba dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yin te /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is precisely the non-perception of any dharma at all that is to be brought to an end or that is to be fully awakened to.

original: 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the bodhisattva's perfection of morality.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyis yongs su zin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyis yongs su zin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by the perfection of skillful means should be known as embraced by all the perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ma bral ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo na gnas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ma bral ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo na gnas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is not separated from all the perfections should be known as standing at the door to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis mnan nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis mnan nas 'gro'o //
translated: He surpasses all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rin po che 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rin po che 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because he desires the jewel of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / mi zhig brag phug tu zhugs te /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig brag phug tu zhugs te /
translated: it is like a man who has entered a cave

analyzed: der 'gro ba na ngos g-yas g-yon na dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul dag mthong @76a *//
translated: and, as he goes in, sees gold, silver, and jewels on his right and left.

original: ste / de ji lta ji ltar nang du 'gro ba de lta de ltar ngos g-yas g-yon na dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul gyis yongs su gang bar mthong zhing /
analyzed: ste / de ji lta ji ltar nang du 'gro ba de lta de ltar ngos g-yas g-yon na dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul gyis yongs su gang bar mthong zhing /
translated: The more he goes inside, the more he sees on the right and left sides heaps of gold, silver, and jewels,

original: mu tig gi chun pos kyang yongs su gang bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: mu tig gi chun pos kyang yongs su gang bar mthong ngo //
translated: and strings of pearls.

original: de gal te de la chags pa bskyed na /
analyzed: de gal te de la chags pa bskyed na /
translated: If he generates desire for them,

original: de'i nang gi rin po che rin thang med pa gang dag yin pa de dag las de yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te der dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul dang / mu tig gi chun po de dag la chags pa mi skyed na ni de de las 'das nas rin po che rin thang med pa rnams gang na yod pa'i phyogs der phyin nas mthong bar 'gyur zhing de rin po che rin thang med pa de dag dang ldan
analyzed: de'i nang gi rin po che rin thang med pa gang dag yin pa de dag las de yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro // gal te der dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul dang / mu tig gi chun po de dag la chags pa mi skyed na ni de de las 'das nas rin po che rin thang med pa rnams gang na yod pa'i phyogs der phyin nas mthong bar 'gyur zhing de rin po che rin thang med pa de dag dang ldan
translated: he will lose the priceless jewels that are inside.

original: par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he does not generate desire for the gold, silver, pearls, and strings of pearls, then after passing beyond that he will arrive at the place where the priceless jewels are, and he will see them and obtain them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du thabs la mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bsngags pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mi mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bsngags pa'am /
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattva who is not skilled in means may praise the level of the śrāvaka or the level of the pratyekabuddha.

original: cho 'phrul lam /
analyzed: cho 'phrul lam /
translated: In the same way, when bodhisattvas who are unskilled in means hear praise of the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽or when they hear about their miracles or their magical powers,

original: rdzu 'phrul brjod pa na der 'ong zhing 'drul la chags par byed na de ltar de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul brjod pa na der 'ong zhing 'drul la chags par byed na de ltar de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be drawn to them and become attached. In this way, they will fall from the jewel of omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,🔽the bodhisattvas who are skilled in means, when they hear praise of the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bsngags pa brjod pa na de dag yid la mi byed cing zil gyis mnan te 'gro'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bsngags pa brjod pa na de dag yid la mi byed cing zil gyis mnan te 'gro'o //
translated: do not pay attention to them and surpass them.

original: de la chags pa'ang mi skyed /
analyzed: de la chags pa'ang mi skyed /
translated: They do not give rise to attachment to them,

original: zhen par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhen par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: nor do they become fixated on them.

original: sred par yang mi byed @76b de; de la sred par mi byed cing yid la mi byed pa des ni zil gyis mnan te 'gro'o //
analyzed: sred par yang mi byed @76b de; de la sred par mi byed cing yid la mi byed pa des ni zil gyis mnan te 'gro'o //
translated: They do not crave them, and by not craving them and not paying attention to them, they surpass them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: The level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / sa 'di gnyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bar chad byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / sa 'di gnyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bar chad byed pa ste /
translated: The stage of the Solitary Buddha and this stage are obstacles to omniscience.

original: 'di dag las 'das nas rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las 'das nas rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having transcended these, one gradually obtains the jewel of omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa!

original: dper na / mi de dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul dang / mu tig gi chun po rnams las 'das te /
analyzed: dper na / mi de dbyig dang / gser dang / dngul dang / mu tig gi chun po rnams las 'das te /
translated: For example, that person, having transcended the heaps of jewels, gold, silver, and pearls,

analyzed: de dag la chags pa mi skyed par nang du zhugs nas rin po che rin thang med pa de dag dang ldan par gyur na bdag nyid kyang spyod la /
translated: without generating attachment to them, having entered inside, becomes endowed with those priceless jewels, and himself enjoys them,

original: sems can rnams la'ang yang dag par 'god pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la'ang yang dag par 'god pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: and he becomes one who has the disposition to establish sentient beings in them as well.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa!

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa'ang sa 'di gnyis la ro mi myang bar 'das nas rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa'ang sa 'di gnyis la ro mi myang bar 'das nas rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva great being who is skilled in means, without savoring those two levels, passes beyond them and gradually obtains the jewel of omniscience.

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de gnyis la rab tu chags na /
translated: If the bodhisattva great being becomes attached to those two,

analyzed: de ni thabs la mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: he should be known as unskilled in means.

original: de bas na thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin pas de la yid brtan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin pas de la yid brtan par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he should not be confident in that, being possessed by skill in means.

original: ji srid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa de srid du byang chub sems dpas yid brtan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa de srid du byang chub sems dpas yid brtan par mi bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should not be confident for as long as he has not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽phyir mi ldog @77a *//
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / phyir mi ldog @77a *//
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid mi brten par mi bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid mi brten par mi bya ba gang yin /
translated: what is the irreversible bodhisattva great being’s lack of confidence?”🔽Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra,

analyzed: smras pa / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ni yid mi brten par mi bya'o //
translated: He replied, One should not rely on the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'dris par spyod pa ni ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'dris par spyod pa ni ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who practices familiarization with the six perfections will before long fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: des 'di ltar bdag yun ring mo zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur du 'ong gi /
analyzed: des 'di ltar bdag yun ring mo zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur du 'ong gi /
translated: One should generate the thought, It may be that I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood after a long time,

analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mgo dang / gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du spyad par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: but I will practice the six perfections as if my head or clothes were on fire.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de bdag tshul khrims 'dis mtshan rnams yongs su 'dzin par gyur cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa de bdag tshul khrims 'dis mtshan rnams yongs su 'dzin par gyur cig /
translated: “By this morality, may I obtain the marks!”

original: ces kun tu spyod pa 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: ces kun tu spyod pa 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar gyur na /
translated: If such thoughts occur to him,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnam par rtog pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: that bodhisattva has entered into conceptualization.

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'chal pa'i tshul khrims yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Whatever conceptualization there is, that should be known as that bodhisattva’s immorality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni mtshan rnams kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @77b chub la 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni mtshan rnams kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @77b chub la 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not engage in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for the sake of the marks.

original: gal te mtshan rnams la mchog tu 'dzin na byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mtshan rnams la mchog tu 'dzin na byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one grasps at the marks as supreme, that bodhisattva should be known as grasping at morality as supreme.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Moral Discipline.

original: le'u lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'o ////
translated: CHAPTER FIVE

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽khyod la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / khyod la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,🔽do you have the knowledge that this bodhisattva is one who holds moral discipline as supreme,

original: 'di ni tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa yod dam /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa yod dam /
translated: and that one is not?”

original: gsol pa / bdag ji ltar bcom ldan 'das la glo ba ches shing /
analyzed: gsol pa / bdag ji ltar bcom ldan 'das la glo ba ches shing /
translated: He replied, “As I have great confidence in the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na gal te byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems bskyed na tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na gal te byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems bskyed na tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: and as I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said, if a bodhisattva arouses his mind for the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, he should be known as one who holds moral discipline as supreme.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Because it is like this:

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems bskyed na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ma lags te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems bskyed na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ma lags te /
translated: If they generate the mind set on the level of a solitary buddha, this is not the domain of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: One should know that a bodhisattva who is fixated on superior discipline is not a bodhisattva.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la dmigs pa'am /
translated: If a bodhisattva generates the mind set on form,

original: sgra la dmigs pa'am /🔽dri la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: sgra la dmigs pa'am / dri la dmigs pa'am /
translated: set on sound,🔽set on smell,

original: ro la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: ro la dmigs pa'am /
translated: set on taste,

original: reg pa la dmigs pa'i sems bskyed na de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bgyid pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //🔽de ci'i @78a *//
analyzed: reg pa la dmigs pa'i sems bskyed na de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bgyid pa lags par rig par bgyi'o // de ci'i @78a *//
translated: or set on touch, one should know that this is not the proper mental activity of a bodhisattva.

original: slad du zhe na /
analyzed: slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bgyid pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i grangs su gtogs la /
translated: Because such improper mental activity is included in the category of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i grangs su gtogs pa de ni skye ba de dang / de dag tu lus yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i grangs su gtogs pa de ni skye ba de dang / de dag tu lus yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is included in the category of afflictions will lead to the appropriation of a body in those births.

original: ji lta ji ltar lus yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lus yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more he takes up a body, the more he takes up the six perfections.

original: ji lta ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The more he takes up the six perfections, the more he approaches the knowledge of all modes.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “To illustrate, Lord,

original: bdag ni 'di la 'di ltar 'tshal te /
analyzed: bdag ni 'di la 'di ltar 'tshal te /
translated: I think thus:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

translated: Because he is armored for the sake of the benefit, welfare, and happiness of countless sentient beings, and because he delivers countless, immeasurable sentient beings from cyclic existence, therefore the bodhisattva’s patience is immeasurable.🔽The listeners, on the other hand, wish to eliminate only the afflictions in their own mindstreams.

analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni de bzhin gshegs pas bshung ba mdzad kyang gnod sems mi 'byung ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gang dag gdol pa'am /

analyzed: smyig ma mkhan nam / g-yung po de dag thams cad kyis spyos sam /

analyzed: brgyad bkag na / de dag la'ang gnod sems mi bya /
translated: the refuse scavengers—were to revile him,🔽he would not give rise to malice.

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na ngan pa 'ongs pa'i tshig gi lam dang du len nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he abides in the perfection of patience, he will be able to endure the verbal abuse of those who come with evil intent.

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra:🔽

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa @87b gang po /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇī­putra, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: 'di la gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la /
analyzed: 'di la gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la /

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: in this regard, a bodhisattva great being who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should not generate attachment toward those people who anoint his body with sandalwood paste,

analyzed: gang lus la me gtong ba de la'ang gnod sems bskyed par mi bya'i gnyis ka la'ang mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya ste /

analyzed: de ltar spyod cing de ltar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa yin no //

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni spyod yul la spyod do //

analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhing la gnas so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnod sems mang bar mi bya ste /

original: 'thab pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: 'thab pa'i rang bzhin can /

original: mtshang 'dru ba'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: mtshang 'dru ba'i rang bzhin can /

analyzed: rtsod pa'i rang bzhin can du gnas pa rnams la sdums bya zhing sdums byed du gzhug par bya ste /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will attain supreme perfect enlightenment and teach the Dharma.’

translated: As the result of that action, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is born with good teeth, even teeth, and close-set teeth, and the bodily signs of a great being are fully formed.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /

analyzed: le'u dang po'o ////

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: He replied, “Venerable one,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dzambu chu bo'i gser ches rgya che ba dang / ches bzang ba dang / ches 'od gsal ba dang / ches rin che ba yin no //
analyzed: dzambu chu bo'i gser ches rgya che ba dang / ches bzang ba dang / ches 'od gsal ba dang / ches rin che ba yin no //

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems @89a *//
translated: In this way, the Bodhisattva

analyzed: dpa' bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin par rig par bya'o //

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas ni sems dang 'dra ba dang / sems chu dang 'dra ba dang / sems me dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should have a mind like the earth, a mind like water, a mind like fire,

analyzed: sems rlung dang 'dra ba dang / sems nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: a mind like wind, and a mind like space.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Śāradvatīputra said, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems sa dang 'dra ba yin zhing /

analyzed: sems chu dang 'dra ba dang / sems me dang 'dra ba dang / sems rlung dang 'dra ba dang / sems nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin /

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Pūrṇa said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: dper na / sa ni yid du 'ong ba'i byug pa rnams kyis byugs na'ang /
translated: For example, even if the earth is anointed with pleasant ointments,🔽

original: rjes su chags pa med la /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa med la /
translated: For example, the earth is not pleased when anointed with pleasant ointments,

original: de las gzhan pa'i yid du mi 'ong bas byugs na'ang khong khro bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yid du mi 'ong bas byugs na'ang khong khro bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: nor is it displeased when anointed with unpleasant substances.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa rnams kyis rjes su chags pa bskyed par mi bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa rnams kyis rjes su chags pa bskyed par mi bya /

analyzed: de ltar na sems chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / 'dra ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva’s mind is like water, fire, and air.

original: ji ltar na sems nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin zhe na /🔽nam mkha' ji ltar yid du 'ong ba'i byug pa rnams kyis kyang rjes su chags par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin zhe na / nam mkha' ji ltar yid du 'ong ba'i byug pa rnams kyis kyang rjes su chags par mi 'gyur la /
translated: How is the mind like space?🔽Space is not made happy by the application of pleasant things,

original: de las gzhan pa'i yid du mi 'ong ba bshang gci rnams yod pas kyang khong khro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yid du mi 'ong ba bshang gci rnams yod pas kyang khong khro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor is it made unhappy by the application of unpleasant things, such as excrement and urine.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams kyis kyang rjes su chags pa bskyed par mi bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams kyis kyang rjes su chags pa bskyed par mi bya /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not generate attachment even by the application of pleasant forms,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba rnams kyis kyang khong khro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba rnams kyis kyang khong khro bar mi bya'o //
translated: nor should he generate aversion even by the application of unpleasant forms.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa yid du 'ong ba rnams kyis kyang rjes su chags pa bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa yid du 'ong ba rnams kyis kyang rjes su chags pa bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, he should not generate attachment even by the application of pleasant sounds, smells, tastes, and touches,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg pa'i bar dag gis kyang khong khro bar mi bya zhing mi bzod pa dang / dang ba chung ba bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg pa'i bar dag gis kyang khong khro bar mi bya zhing mi bzod pa dang / dang ba chung ba bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: up to he should not generate aversion even by the application of unpleasant touches, nor should he generate impatience and little clarity.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should know that the mind is like space.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems sa dang 'dra ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems sa dang 'dra ba yin zhing /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's mind is like the earth,

original: sems chu dang 'dra ba dang / sems me dang 'dra ba dang / sems rlung dang 'dra ba dang / sems nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: sems chu dang 'dra ba dang / sems me dang 'dra ba dang / sems rlung dang 'dra ba dang / sems nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: like water, like fire, like wind, and like space.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: He said, Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ni bgrang du med pa na /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ni bgrang du med pa na /
translated: if it is immeasurable like space,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' yang bgrang du med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' yang bgrang du med pa zhig gam /
translated: is the bodhisattva also immeasurable?

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa @90a *//
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa @90a *//
translated: He said, Venerable

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas lus kyi yid 'di nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam par brtag par ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas lus kyi yid 'di nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam par brtag par ste /
translated: here the bodhisattva should investigate this mental body as being like space.

original: de ltar dpyod cing rtog na /
analyzed: de ltar dpyod cing rtog na /
translated: If one examines and investigates in this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbyug pa'i reg pa rnams dang / bong ba'i reg pa rnams dang / mtshon cha'i reg pa rnams dang du len pa la mthu yod cing mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbyug pa'i reg pa rnams dang / bong ba'i reg pa rnams dang / mtshon cha'i reg pa rnams dang du len pa la mthu yod cing mkhas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva has the power and skill to accept the touch of sticks, the touch of clods, and the touch of weapons.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas lus kun la so sor brtags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas lus kun la so sor brtags te /

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su 'dzin cing sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal gang dag yin pa dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i me gang yin pa dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i mtshon cha dang / dbyug pa'i reg pa gang dag yin pa de rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su 'dzin pa la dang du len pa'i mthu yod pa yin te /
translated: He also takes up the perfection of patience, and has the power and skill to accept the sufferings of the hells, the fires of the hells, the weapons and sticks of the hells.

original: dang du len pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: dang du len pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: That acceptance is the perfection of patience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sdug bsngal de dag so sor myong la /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sdug bsngal de dag so sor myong la /
translated: Since beginningless saṃsāra, they have experienced each of those sufferings.

original: sdug bsngal rnams myong nas kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang ma thob /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams myong nas kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang ma thob /
translated: Even though they have experienced those sufferings, they have not attained the fruit of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang ma yin /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang ma yin /

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang ma yin /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang ma yin / dgra bcom pa nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: nor the fruit of non-returner,🔽nor the state of a worthy one,

analyzed: rang byang chub kyang ma thob ste /
translated: nor the state of a pratyekabuddha.
