analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos don gyi @90b dbang 'di'ang yang dag par rjes su mthong nas sdug bsngal de dag dang du blang bar bya'o // dper na / mi la la zhig kha zas ro brgya ba za na tshim pa dang / mos pa dang / yi rangs pa dang / mgu bar 'gyur zhing dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: Having seen this meaning, bodhisattva great beings should accept those sufferings.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if a person were to eat food with a hundred flavors, they would be satisfied, interested, delighted, and pleased, and would experience joy and mental ease.

original: byang chub sems dpas slong ba mthong na gang de la lus sdug bsngal bar bya bar 'dod pa zhig yin du zin kyang ji ltar dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / gus pa bskyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas slong ba mthong na gang de la lus sdug bsngal bar bya bar 'dod pa zhig yin du zin kyang ji ltar dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong na dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / gus pa bskyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: in just the same way,

original: byang chub sems dpas slong ba'i gang zag de la sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas slong ba'i gang zag de la sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will arouse a thought of devotion toward this person who is begging from me.

original: sems bskyed pa skyes so cog kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa skyes so cog kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: And whatever thoughts of devotion I arouse, I will dedicate them all to complete knowing.

original: yongs su bsngo na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: If I dedicate them, then the bodhisattva great being should be known as abiding in the perfection of patience.”

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Patience

original: le'u gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'o ////
translated: Chapter II

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gshe'ang phyir mi gshe ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gshe'ang phyir mi gshe ste /
translated: Furthermore, a bodhisattva great being should not retaliate when insulted.

original: bzod pa 'ba' zhig byed do //
analyzed: bzod pa 'ba' zhig byed do //
translated: He practices only patience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

analyzed: des thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro // brdegs kyang phyir mi brdeg khros kyang phyir mi khro /
translated: Because he does not give up omniscience.

original: bsdigs kyang phyir sdigs par mi byed /
analyzed: bsdigs kyang phyir sdigs par mi byed /
translated: Even if he is beaten, he does not beat in return; even if he is angry, he does not get angry in return;🔽even if he is threatened, he does not threaten in return;

original: spyos kyang phyir spyo bar mi byed de bzod pa 'ba' zhig byed do //
analyzed: spyos kyang phyir spyo bar mi byed de bzod pa 'ba' zhig byed do //
translated: even if he is reviled, he does not revile in return. He practices only patience.

original: @91a *// de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @91a *// de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: des thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not give up omniscience.

original: gal te de la mdung thung dang / mda' stong gis lus la phog kyang de la sems sdang bar mi bya /
analyzed: gal te de la mdung thung dang / mda' stong gis lus la phog kyang de la sems sdang bar mi bya /
translated: Even if a thousand spears and arrows strike his body, he should not give rise to anger,

analyzed: de la mi bzod pa dang / dad pa med pa dang / ngang thung ba bskyed par mi bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar spyod na byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin te /
translated: If he practices like that, the bodhisattva practices the perfection of patience.

original: lus la'ang gser gyi kha dog yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la'ang gser gyi kha dog yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and his body will be the color of gold.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can du bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can du bya'o //
translated: therefore bodhisattva great beings should have the power of patience and should have a nature that is tolerant.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

analyzed: bzod cing dang du len pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: patience and tolerance are the means of upholding the perfection of patience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur la /
translated: It brings one closer to omniscience,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang ring bar byed do //🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang ring bar byed do // gal te byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: and it makes the sufferings of saṃsāra seem distant.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
translated: If a bodhisattva wishes for the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas, that bodhisattva will fall from the perfection of patience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus la sdug bsngal de snyed byung ba dang du blangs kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: lus la sdug bsngal de snyed byung ba dang du blangs kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Even if they were to endure such suffering in their bodies, they would still aspire to the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpas rang gi spyod yul bor te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rang gi spyod yul bor te /
translated: You should know that the bodhisattvas would be abandoning their own domain

original: gzhan gyi spyod yul la gnas pa yin par yang rig par @91b bya'o; ;smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi spyod yul la gnas pa yin par yang rig par @91b bya'o; ;smras pa /
translated: and remaining in the domain of others.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi spyod yul la spyod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi spyod yul la spyod pa zhes bya /
translated: to what extent is it said that bodhisattvas are practicing in the domain of others?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Pūrṇa replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: if bodhisattvas are practicing in the domain of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: the domain of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa rnams sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa rnams sam /
translated: the mental engagements of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa rnams sam /
translated: the mental engagements of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
translated: the path of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'dod pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi spyod yul la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'dod pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi spyod yul la spyod pa yin no //
translated: To the extent that one desires the path of the pratyekabuddha, to that extent one is engaged in the domain of the bodhisattva.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi spyod yul gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi spyod yul gang yin /
translated: what is the domain of the bodhisattva?”

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: Pūrṇa said, “It is as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan par yid la byed pa ste /
translated: It is the bringing to mind of the six perfections in connection with omniscience.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Thus, it is the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul te /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom. These are the domain of the bodhisattva.

analyzed: 'di dag la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' rang gi spyod yul la spyod pa yin no //
translated: If one practices them, the bodhisattva is engaged in his or her own domain.”

original: de la ni bdud sdig can gyis kyang glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de la ni bdud sdig can gyis kyang glags mi rnyed de /
translated: Māra the wicked one will not find an opportunity to harm them.

original: dper na / rus sbal la was glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: dper na / rus sbal la was glags mi rnyed de /
translated: For example, a fox cannot find an opportunity to harm a tortoise.

original: de glags ma rnyed nas skyo ste phyir 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de glags ma rnyed nas skyo ste phyir 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: Not finding an opportunity, it becomes discouraged and goes away.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa la bdud sdig @92a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa la bdud sdig @92a *//
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: can gyis glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: can gyis glags mi rnyed de /
translated: Māra the wicked one cannot find an opportunity to harm bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections.

original: glags ma rnyed nas skyo ste phyir 'gro'o //
analyzed: glags ma rnyed nas skyo ste phyir 'gro'o //
translated: Not finding an opportunity, he becomes discouraged and goes away.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gal te bdud sdig can gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi bdud sdig can mngon par sprul la bdud re re'ang de snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te bdud sdig can gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi bdud sdig can mngon par sprul la bdud re re'ang de snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor bar gyur kyang /
translated: if Māra the wicked one were to manifest as many wicked Māras as there are sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm, and if each wicked Māra were surrounded by an entourage of that many,

analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa la glags rnyed pa'i skal ba med de /
translated: They have no chance to find an opportunity to harm the bodhisattva great beings who practice the six perfections.

original: glags ma rnyed pas skyo nas phyir 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: glags ma rnyed pas skyo nas phyir 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Not finding an opportunity, they become discouraged and leave.

original: rus sbal dang / wa bzhin no //
analyzed: rus sbal dang / wa bzhin no //

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /

analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las su rig par bya /

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: ” He said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

translated: Not practicing the perfections is a bodhisattva’s māra karma.🔽Māra, the evil one, is present to create obstacles to my omniscience.

analyzed: mi bzod pa bskyed par mi bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar spyod na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Practicing like this, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the perfection of patience.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva should think, ‘After I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de'i tshe dran pa rnyed na /

analyzed: bdud sdig can zil gyis non pa yin no //

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dag dang bral bar gyur na bdag spyod yul ma yin par lhung bar ma gyur grang zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dag dang bral bar gyur na bdag spyod yul ma yin par lhung bar ma gyur grang zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: When a bodhisattva becomes separated from the mental activity of omniscience, he should know, ‘I have fallen into an inappropriate domain.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar bdag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bdag nyid kyi sems la brgyad bkag par bya'o //
translated: Because I am not endowed with omniscience.’ In this way, he should restrain his own mind.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' nyin mo chud zos par byed pa yin /

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams las gang yang rung ba spyod pa na /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi sems sam /

analyzed: nyin mo de ni zhe na @93a *//

analyzed: pa dang / rmugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' phyi nyin nam /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' phyi nyin nam /

analyzed: yang na phyi ma'i nyin par ram /

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /🔽bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam / bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: diligence,

original: shes rab la sems par gyur la /
analyzed: shes rab la sems par gyur la /

analyzed: bsams nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na de ltar de'i nyin mo ni don yod pa yin te /
translated: Having reflected in this way, if he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, then that day is not wasted.

analyzed: sbyin pa de'ang 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That generosity is fruitful.

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /
translated: If he cultivates morality,

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam; bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam; bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: patience, perseverance,

analyzed: shes rab gang yang rung ba sgom pa de'ang 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: meditative concentration, or wisdom, that is fruitful.

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Pūrṇa,🔽what is the difference between the patience of a bodhisattva and the patience of an arhat who has destroyed the contaminants?

analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba ni gang yin /

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / ri rab dang yungs 'bru la / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: che chung dang / mtho dma' dang / lci yang gi khyad par ni ci yod /
translated: What is the distinction between them?”

original: tha dad du dbye ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba ni gang yin /
translated: What is the difference between them?

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / yungs 'bru ni /
translated: Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, and a mustard seed

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: che chung dang / mtho dma' dang / lci yang gi khyad par dpag tu med de /

original: tha dad du dbye ba dpag tu med do //
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba dpag tu med do //
translated: and an immeasurable difference between them.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de de @93b bzhin te /
analyzed: de de @93b bzhin te /
translated: it is just so.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa dang / nyan thos kyis bzod pa ni khyad par dpag tu med cing /
translated: The bodhisattva’s patience and the hearers’ patience are immeasurable and

original: tha dad du dbye ba dpag tu med do //
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba dpag tu med do //
translated: incomparable.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po'i chu dang / rgya mtsho chen po'i chu las skra'i rtse mo'i khyon gyis chu'i thigs pa gcig blangs pa gang yin pa de la ches mang ba'am /
translated: for example, the water in the great ocean and a drop of water taken from the great ocean with the tip of a hair are like this: which is greater,

original: ches dpag tu med pa gang yin /
analyzed: ches dpag tu med pa gang yin /
translated: which is immeasurable?

original: smras pa / rgya mtsho chen po'i chu la ni skra'i rtse mo'i khyon gyis blangs pa'i chu'i thigs pa gcig gis brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /
analyzed: smras pa / rgya mtsho chen po'i chu la ni skra'i rtse mo'i khyon gyis blangs pa'i chu'i thigs pa gcig gis brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /
translated: He replied, The water contained in a drop on the tip of a hair taken from the body of a horse or an elephant is not even a hundredth part of the water in the great ocean.

original: rgyu'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It is not even a thousandth part, and so on up to: it is not even a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part, and it is not even a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part of a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa la nyan thos kyi bzod pas /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa la nyan thos kyi bzod pas /
translated: He replied, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: in the same way, the acceptance of the śrāvakas in relation to the acceptance of the bodhisattvas is not even a hundredth part.

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It is not even a thousandth part, and so on up to: it is not even a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part, and it is not even a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part of a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la bka' stsal pa /🔽gang po / 'di ltar khyod sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la bka' stsal pa /🔽gang po / 'di ltar khyod sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, Pūrṇa, in this way, through the power of the Buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spobs par byas pa legs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spobs par byas pa legs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is excellent, excellent that you have inspired the bodhisattva great beings to speak about the perfection of patience.

original: legs so // gang po /
analyzed: legs so // gang po /
translated: Excellent, Subhūti!

original: 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i tshad 'dzin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzod pa la tshad 'dzin par 'dod cing rab tu @94a *//🔽rnam par dbye bar sems su zad do //
analyzed: 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i tshad 'dzin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzod pa la tshad 'dzin par 'dod cing rab tu @94a *// rnam par dbye bar sems su zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wishes to measure the patience of the bodhisattva great beings wishes to measure and make distinctions in the patience of the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang po / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni bzod pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang po / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni bzod pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva great beings possess immeasurable patience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One having said that,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / byams ma'i bu gang po dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu nas lhags pa de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang /🔽dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / byams ma'i bu gang po dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu nas lhags pa de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who had come from the ten directions,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: le'u gsum pa ste rdzogs so ////
analyzed: le'u gsum pa ste rdzogs so ////
translated: This concludes the third chapter of “The Perfection of Patience,”🔽from the Great Vehicle sūtra “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na; bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na; bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na /
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time, the Blessed One was dwelling in the Jeta Grove of Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Śrāvastī,

original: dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra asked the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal bas ji tsam gyis na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal bas ji tsam gyis na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa lags /
translated: to what extent does a bodhisattva great being stand in the perfection of perseverance, wishing to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: @94b de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: @94b de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been asked this, said to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra,

original: gang po / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gang po / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Pūrṇa, here bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, from the time of their first production of the thought of awakening,

original: 'di ltar bdag gi lus 'di dang / bdag gi khog pa 'dis gzhan gyi bya ba rnams dang / gzhan gyi yo byad rnams la thog mar 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi lus 'di dang / bdag gi khog pa 'dis gzhan gyi bya ba rnams dang / gzhan gyi yo byad rnams la thog mar 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, I will first go to the service of others and to the possessions of others with this body of mine, with this belly of mine.

original: bdag gis sems can de dag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /🔽dper na / bran mo chu chun bzhin du bdag gis bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can de dag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ste / dper na / bran mo chu chun bzhin du bdag gis bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will fulfill the wishes of those sentient beings.🔽I will do so like a servant girl fetching water.

original: dper na / bran mo chu chun ni 'di ltar bdag gi rang dgar 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / bran mo chu chun ni 'di ltar bdag gi rang dgar 'dug pa'am /
translated: For example, a servant girl fetching water thinks like this: ‘I will not stay here of my own accord.

original: nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: I will not lie down.

original: gal te bdag khyim nas tshong 'dus su 'gro ba na rje bo dang / rje mo de nyid la zhus te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag khyim nas tshong 'dus su 'gro ba na rje bo dang / rje mo de nyid la zhus te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If I go from home to the marketplace, I will go only after asking my master and mistress.

original: bza' ba'am / bca' ba de'ang gang gi tshe /
analyzed: bza' ba'am / bca' ba de'ang gang gi tshe /
translated: And when I eat or drink,

original: bdag la gnang bar gyur na de'i tshe bdag gis phyis bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la gnang bar gyur na de'i tshe bdag gis phyis bza' bar bya ste /
translated: I will eat or drink only after asking my master and mistress.🔽I will live under the control of my master.’

original: bdag gis rje bo'i dbang du gnas par bya'o snyam pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag gis rje bo'i dbang du gnas par bya'o snyam pa de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, you should think like this:

original: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas 'di ltar bdag gi lus la bdag mi dbang ste /🔽gzhan gyi bya ba rnams dang / gzhan gyi @95a *//
analyzed: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas 'di ltar bdag gi lus la bdag mi dbang ste / gzhan gyi bya ba rnams dang / gzhan gyi @95a *//
translated: Pūrṇa, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should generate the thought, ‘I do not control my body.

original: yo byad rnams la bdag gis phan thogs par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed bar bya ste /
analyzed: yo byad rnams la bdag gis phan thogs par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed bar bya ste /
translated: I should be of benefit to others’ activities and others’ possessions.’

original: gang po / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang po / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'bral bar bya'o //
translated: Pūrṇa, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should not be separated from the perfection of perseverance in that way.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par yang bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par yang bya'o //
translated: They should abide in the perfection of perseverance in that way.

original: gang po / dper na /
analyzed: gang po / dper na /
translated: Pūrṇa, it is like this:

original: la la zhig la rta rin po che yod de /
analyzed: la la zhig la rta rin po che yod de /
translated: Suppose someone has a precious horse.

original: mi la la zhig gis zhon la /
analyzed: mi la la zhig gis zhon la /
translated: Someone else mounts it.

original: de nas rta rin po che de 'di snyam du bdag gis mi 'di'i yan lag gang yang rung ba g-yo ba'am /
analyzed: de nas rta rin po che de 'di snyam du bdag gis mi 'di'i yan lag gang yang rung ba g-yo ba'am /
translated: Then that precious horse thinks, ‘I should move any of this person’s limbs

original: snang bar mi 'gyur bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: snang bar mi 'gyur bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: “I will not let him be seen.”

original: de'i rta bdag gi sems kyi rang dgar mi 'gro bar; mi 'di bdag gi lan gyis nyes pa ci'ang 'byung bar mi bya'o snyam du zhon pa'i mi de nyid srung bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rta bdag gi sems kyi rang dgar mi 'gro bar; mi 'di bdag gi lan gyis nyes pa ci'ang 'byung bar mi bya'o snyam du zhon pa'i mi de nyid srung bar byed do //
translated: The horse-keeper does not let his mind go its own way, but protects the rider by thinking, ‘I will not let this man suffer any harm because of me.’

original: gang po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par dmigs par 'dod pas bdag gi sems kyi dbang du 'gro bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par dmigs par 'dod pas bdag gi sems kyi dbang du 'gro bar mi bya ste /
translated: Pūrṇa, in the same way, when bodhisattvas are intent on the perfection of perseverance, they should not let their minds go their own way.

original: sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams su'ang rung /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams su'ang rung /
translated: They should not let other sentient beings, or other persons,

original: bdag la dmigs pas nyes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag la dmigs pas nyes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: suffer any harm because of them.

original: yon tan 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la yod do //
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la yod do //
translated: These are the qualities that bodhisattva great beings have.

original: gang po / de ltar byang chub sems dpas pha rol rjes su bsrung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gang po / de ltar byang chub sems dpas pha rol rjes su bsrung bar bya zhing /
translated: Pūrṇa, in this way bodhisattvas should protect others,

original: mthun par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mthun par gnas par bya'o //
translated: and they should live in harmony with them.

original: mthun par gnas shing rjes su bsrung na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: mthun par gnas shing rjes su bsrung na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: If he lives in harmony and is protected, he takes hold of the perfection of perseverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' @95b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @95b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: The non-retrogression of the bodhisattva from omniscience is also the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's perfection of perseverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gal te bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu yongs su dag par ji ltar bya zhes shin tu yun ring por mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gal te bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu yongs su dag par ji ltar bya zhes shin tu yun ring por mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: If the bodhisattva, for a very long time, connects with the thought, How should I make my buddha-field very pure? and transmigrates, this is also the bodhisattva's perfection of perseverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'am /
translated: If the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, in this trichiliocosm, were to be obstructed by one birth,

original: skye ba gnyis kyis thogs pa'am /
analyzed: skye ba gnyis kyis thogs pa'am /
translated: or two births,

original: skye ba gsum gyis thogs pa'am /
analyzed: skye ba gsum gyis thogs pa'am /
translated: or three births,

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la /
translated: For a bodhisattva who is a beginner in the vehicle,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: someone might say,

original: khyod thog ma kho nar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod thog ma kho nar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gyis shig /
translated: “You should first fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽I will fully awaken later.”

original: kho bo ni phyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes zer ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo ni phyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes zer ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: This is also a bodhisattva’s perfection of perseverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gal te slong ba mthong na gud du phyogs par mi byed cing dbang po rnams kyang g-yeng bar mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gal te slong ba mthong na gud du phyogs par mi byed cing dbang po rnams kyang g-yeng bar mi byed de /
translated: If a bodhisattva, on seeing a beggar, does not turn away and does not distract the senses,

original: sems can 'di ni bdag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan 'dogs pa yin no snyam pa 'di'ang /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni bdag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan 'dogs pa yin no snyam pa 'di'ang /
translated: thinking, “This being is helpful to my omniscience,”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: this is also a bodhisattva’s perfection of perseverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gal te sems can gcig @96a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gal te sems can gcig @96a *//
translated: If a bodhisattva, for the sake of even one being,

original: gi ched du'ang bskal pa'am /
analyzed: gi ched du'ang bskal pa'am /
translated: for an eon or

original: bskal pa las lhag par sems can dmyal ba chen por bdag btso bar spro bar byed cing sems can 'di ni bde bar gyur cig snyam pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par sems can dmyal ba chen por bdag btso bar spro bar byed cing sems can 'di ni bde bar gyur cig snyam pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: And if he were to think, “I would rather be boiled in the great hells for eons than that this being should be happy,” this would be the perfection of perseverance of a bodhisattva great being.

original: gal te yang nyi ma bskal pa'i tshad tsam du gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang nyi ma bskal pa'i tshad tsam du gyur la /
translated: “If the sun were to last for eons,

original: nyi ma'i tshad de dag gi bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sems can dmyal ba chen por bdag btso zhing sems can dmyal ba ba'i sems can gang yin pa de dag ni de las byung bar gyur cig snyam ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i tshad de dag gi bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sems can dmyal ba chen por bdag btso zhing sems can dmyal ba ba'i sems can gang yin pa de dag ni de las byung bar gyur cig snyam ste /
translated: and if I were to be boiled in the great hells for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges river, and if the beings in the hells were to be released from there,

original: gal te de dag gis 'thob pa'i chos shig yod na byang chub sems dpas khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag gis 'thob pa'i chos shig yod na byang chub sems dpas khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: if there were a Dharma that they could obtain, the bodhisattva would accept it.

original: gal te khas len na 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te khas len na 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: If he accepts it, this too is the perfection of perseverance of a bodhisattva.

original: gal te zhum zhing mi dga' na byang chub sems dpa'i le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te zhum zhing mi dga' na byang chub sems dpa'i le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he is discouraged and unhappy, he should know that he is a lazy bodhisattva.

original: gal te sems dang sems su mnyam na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems su mnyam na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he is equal-minded toward all beings, he should know that he is a bodhisattva great being who has begun to practice diligence.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' dzambu gling 'di kho ra khor yug 'phyag cing 'ongs te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' dzambu gling 'di kho ra khor yug 'phyag cing 'ongs te /
translated: If a bodhisattva were to sweep this Rose Apple Continent all the way to the ocean,

original: phyogs de nyid du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: phyogs de nyid du 'ongs nas /
translated: and then come to this very place,

original: 'di skad du /🔽bdag 'ongs nas shin tu yun ring ngo snyam du sems na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du / bdag 'ongs nas shin tu yun ring ngo snyam du sems na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and think,🔽‘I have been gone for a very long time,’ he should know that he is a lazy bodhisattva.

original: gal te 'di snyam du bdag myur du 'ongs @96b so snyam du sems na ni byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bdag myur du 'ongs @96b so snyam du sems na ni byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: If he thinks, ‘I have been gone for a very short time,’ he should know that he is a bodhisattva who has begun to practice diligence.

original: 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no; ;gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mchod rten nam /
analyzed: 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no; ;gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mchod rten nam /
translated: This is the perfection of perseverance of bodhisattva great beings.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta byed cing nyin mo 'gro ba na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta byed cing nyin mo 'gro ba na /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings who are in charge of a stūpa or the Saṅgha go out during the day,

original: 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'di snyam du /
translated: they should think,

original: kye ma nyi ma 'di re ring /
analyzed: kye ma nyi ma 'di re ring /
translated: ‘Oh, this sun is going so slowly!🔽It is going so slowly!’

original: 'di re bul du 'gro snyam du sems na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di re bul du 'gro snyam du sems na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If they think that, you should know that those bodhisattvas are lazy.

original: gal te 'di snyam du nyi ma 'di se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis song ngo snyam du sems na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du nyi ma 'di se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis song ngo snyam du sems na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: If they think, ‘This sun has gone as fast as a finger snap,’ you should know that those bodhisattva great beings have begun to persevere,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no //
translated: and that bodhisattvas are persevering in the perfection of perseverance.

original: yang de'i las lo gcig gi bya ba gang yin pa'i las de nyi ma gcig gi las 'dra bar bsam zhing lo gcig gi bya ba'i las de nyi ma gcig gis zin par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de'i las lo gcig gi bya ba gang yin pa'i las de nyi ma gcig gi las 'dra bar bsam zhing lo gcig gi bya ba'i las de nyi ma gcig gis zin par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should think that the work of a year is like the work of a day, and that the work of a year is completed in a day.

original: bskal pa las lhag pa'i tshad gang yin pa de nyi ma gcig tsam du rtsi zhing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag pa'i tshad gang yin pa de nyi ma gcig tsam du rtsi zhing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the measure of more than an eon, that should be reckoned as just a day.

original: bskal pa gang yin pa de'ang nyi ma gcig tsam du brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa gang yin pa de'ang nyi ma gcig tsam du brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: And whatever is an eon should be reckoned as just a day.

original: gal te de ltar mi rtsi zhing de ltar mi rtog na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi rtsi zhing de ltar mi rtog na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one does not reckon in that way, and does not think in that way, one should know that the bodhisattva is lazy.

original: ji ste de ltar rtsi zhing de ltar rtog na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par @97a *//
analyzed: ji ste de ltar rtsi zhing de ltar rtog na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par @97a *//
translated: But if one does reckon in that way, and does think in that way, one should know that the bodhisattva mahāsattva has begun to make an effort.

original: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi phyir spyod pas bskal pa 'di snyed kyis na rang gi mngon par shes pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bskal pa rnams kyi grangs brjod par
analyzed: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi phyir spyod pas bskal pa 'di snyed kyis na rang gi mngon par shes pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bskal pa rnams kyi grangs brjod par
translated: “The bodhisattva who practices for awakening should not say, ‘In this many eons will I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood through my own super-knowledge.’

original: mi bya'o // gal te bskal pa rnams kyi tshad brjod na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bya'o // gal te bskal pa rnams kyi tshad brjod na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he were to say that, he should be known as a lazy bodhisattva.

original: gal te de 'di snyam du bskal pa dpag tu med pa dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur du zin kyang phyir phyogs par ni ye mi bya'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te de 'di snyam du bskal pa dpag tu med pa dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur du zin kyang phyir phyogs par ni ye mi bya'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If he thinks, ‘Even if it takes countless eons to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, I will never turn back,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: he should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has begun to practice diligence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: He is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is well-established in the perfection of effort.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He approaches omniscience.

original: 'khor ba ring bar byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba ring bar byed do //
translated: He makes saṃsāra long.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' la ri'i rgyal po ri rab 'di khyod kyis nyi ma gcig gis phigs par gyis shig ces bsgo la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' la ri'i rgyal po ri rab 'di khyod kyis nyi ma gcig gis phigs par gyis shig ces bsgo la /
translated: If someone were to say to the bodhisattva, 'You must shatter this king of mountains, Mount Meru, in one day,'

original: gal te ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi tshad ji tsam pa 'dri na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi tshad ji tsam pa 'dri na byang chub sems dpa' le lo can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and if he were to ask how big the king of mountains, Mount Meru, is, one should know that the bodhisattva is lazy.

original: gal te ri rgyal ri rab la yungs 'bru tsam zhig @97b 'bigs par nus su zin kyang ri'i rgyal po ri rab 'di lta bu zhig la dbug tu ci yod de /
analyzed: gal te ri rgyal ri rab la yungs 'bru tsam zhig @97b 'bigs par nus su zin kyang ri'i rgyal po ri rab 'di lta bu zhig la dbug tu ci yod de /
translated: Even if he were able to pierce Mount Meru, the king of mountains, with something the size of a mustard seed, what is the use of piercing such a king of mountains, Mount Meru?🔽This is like being pierced already.

original: 'di ni phigs zin ba dang 'dra'o snyam du mthong zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni phigs zin ba dang 'dra'o snyam du mthong zhing /
translated: Thinking thus, he sees

original: nyin gcig kyang yun ring gi /
analyzed: nyin gcig kyang yun ring gi /
translated: that even one day is long.

original: se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis dbug go snyam ste de ltar rtsi bar 'jug na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis dbug go snyam ste de ltar rtsi bar 'jug na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he were to think, “I will pierce it in the time it takes to snap a finger,” and were to engage in such a calculation, then that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has begun to make an effort.

translated: Therefore, it should be understood that a bodhisattva great being who has undertaken perseverance is one who has undertaken the perfection of perseverance.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du gang gi phyir chos 'di dag stong pa de'i phyir stong pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar nus so //

translated: If a bodhisattva thinks, “Since these dharmas are empty, therefore, because of emptiness, I can fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,”

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na 'gro ba lnga'i sems can 'di dag 'khor ba las rab tu rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir chos bshad par bya'o //

translated: When I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will teach the Dharma so that these beings in the five forms of life will be completely liberated from cyclic existence.🔽I will teach it in detail.

original: rgyas par rab tu bstan par bya'o snyam du sems na ni 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par rab tu bstan par bya'o snyam du sems na ni 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he thinks like that, you should know that this is the bodhisattva great being’s perfection of perseverance.

original: gal te de 'di snyam du 'khor ba thog ma dang / tha ma med pa 'dir su zhig 'khor zhing 'dug ste /
analyzed: gal te de 'di snyam du 'khor ba thog ma dang / tha ma med pa 'dir su zhig 'khor zhing 'dug ste /

translated: I am not enthusiastic. I will fully attain nirvāṇa right here,’ you should know that the bodhisattva is lazy.

analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bdag ji srid du mtshams sbyar zhing 'khor ba de srid du /

original: de'ang mtshams sbyar zhing 'khor bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'ang mtshams sbyar zhing 'khor bar bya dgos la /
translated: They will also have to connect with and wander in cyclic existence.

analyzed: 'on kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems la /

analyzed: yang de 'di snyam du ji ltar sems bskyed pa 'di ltar 'gro ba bzhin du /

analyzed: nyi ma'ang sems bskyed pa tsam du snang ngo snyam du sems shing /

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems yongs su dag par byas pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems yongs su dag par byas pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /

analyzed: dper na / tshong dpon zhig gis 'bum phrag mang po ri ba'i rin po che thob na /

analyzed: de khyim gyi bya ba rnams dang / de las gzhan pa bun skyin btang ba dang / 'du ba gang ci'ang rung ba rnams kyang yid la mi sems so //

analyzed: nam zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che thob par 'gyur snyam pa 'ba' zhig yid la byed do //

analyzed: gang po / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi nang na / de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa'i @102a *//

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par 'jog pa na /

analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan 'di la bdag gis sngon yang snyoms par zhugs te /

translated: “When entering the first concentration, do not settle into meditative equipoise thinking, ‘I have entered the meditative absorption of cyclic existence without beginning or end.’

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, think, ‘May this become the basis for fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.’

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la mnyam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la mnyam par 'jog pa na /
translated: Similarly, when settling into meditative equipoise in the second, third, and fourth concentrations,

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa 'di la bdag gis sngon yang snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa 'di la bdag gis sngon yang snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: do not settle into meditative equipoise thinking, ‘I have generated the fourth concentration before.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'di la sngon 'khor ba thog ma dang / tha ma med pa'i skye bar snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'di la sngon 'khor ba thog ma dang / tha ma med pa'i skye bar snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: In this fourth concentration, I have entered the meditative absorption of cyclic existence without beginning or end.

original: sngon yang bdag gis bsam gtan 'di dag bskyed do snyam du mnyam @104a *//🔽par bzhag par mi bya yi /
analyzed: sngon yang bdag gis bsam gtan 'di dag bskyed do snyam du mnyam @104a *//🔽par bzhag par mi bya yi /
translated: In the past, I have also generated these concentrations.’🔽Rather, think, ‘May this become the basis for fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.’

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la phan 'dogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la phan 'dogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and will be of benefit in fully and completely awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten nas /
translated: Relying on the fourth concentration,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par bsgrub par bya dgos te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par bsgrub par bya dgos te /

original: byang chub sems dpa' snga ma rnams kyis kyang 'di ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyam par bzhag cing bsgoms te /

translated: In the same way, former bodhisattvas also, having settled in meditative stabilization in the perfection of concentration, meditated.

original: de bas na bdag gis kyang 'di la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis kyang 'di la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I also should train in just this.🔽“Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'dod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par 'dod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: if bodhisattva great beings who want to stand in the perfection of concentration also accomplish the perfection of wisdom,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pas zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ni mnyam par bzhag par mi bya yi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pas zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ni mnyam par bzhag par mi bya yi /
translated: bodhisattva great beings standing in the fourth concentration should not settle in meditative stabilization in order to manifest the destruction of the outflows.

original: 'di ni bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rten yin no //

original: de bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: de bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par 'jog pa na /

analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / bsam gtan gyi bde ba dang / bsam gtan gyi rgyu mthun pa'i ro myang bar mi byed de /

analyzed: 'on kyang gnas pa des gnas par byed do; ;de bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas nas /

analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog cing mngon par sgrub bo //

analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas @104b skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog cing mngon par sgrub bo //

analyzed: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog cing mngon par sgrub bo //

analyzed: srog chags kyi rigs srin bu me khyer yang bya ba de nyid kyis nye bar gnas sam /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: gang po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bya ba gang gis nye bar gnas pa des nyan thos nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gang po / 'di ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bya ba gang gis nye bar gnas snyam /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Pūrṇa replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di lta bus gnas te /

analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par bya bar bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i bya ba des nye bar gnas pa lags te /

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni de lta ma lags so //
translated: This is not the case for the hearers.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang po / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: gang po / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Pūrṇa, what do you think?🔽Do you see even a single monk in this saṅgha of hearers who is present because of the activity of a bodhisattva?”

translated: Pūrṇa replied,

original: de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis so //
translated: “Blessed One, there is none.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Pūrṇa,

analyzed: gang po / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis don gyi dbang 'di yang dag par gzigs nas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'ba' zhig gi spang bar bya ba bsngags kyi nyan thos rnams kyi ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: praises the abandonment of only the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, not that of the śrāvakas.

original: gang po / dper na /
analyzed: gang po / dper na /
translated: Pūrṇa, it is like this:

analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams la snang ba dpag tu med pa'i nye bar gnas pa yin la srog chags kyi rigs srin bu me khyer ni /
translated: The orb of the sun is present for the people of the world with immeasurable light, but the class of creatures called fireflies

analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rgyud nyi tshe snang bar nye bar gnas par zad do //

original: gang po / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag ni 'di ltar rang gi rgyud nyi tshe'i nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir nye bar gnas par zad kyi /
analyzed: gang po / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag ni 'di ltar rang gi rgyud nyi tshe'i nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir nye bar gnas par zad kyi /
translated: Pūrṇa, in the same way, the person in the Śrāvaka Vehicle is present only to turn back the afflictions of their own continuum,

original: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang / gzhan mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / sems can dpag tu med cing grangs med pa rnams kyi don gyi phyir dang / nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang / gzhan mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / sems can dpag tu med cing grangs med pa rnams kyi don gyi phyir dang / nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa yin na /
translated: Pūrṇa, the bodhisattva is present for the sake of the nirvāṇa of self and others, for the sake of the welfare of countless, innumerable sentient beings, and for the sake of the cessation of afflictions.

original: gang po / dper na /
analyzed: gang po / dper na /
translated: Pūrṇa, it is like this:

analyzed: 'phong gi slob dpon mtshon cha la goms shing mkhas par gyur pa ni /

analyzed: lo gcig tu'ang rgyal po'i ka  sha pa ni brgya stong za zhing /

analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyal po g-yul 'gyed pa'i dus la bab pa @113a *//
translated: When the time comes for the king to go to war,

analyzed: de'i tshe / ji ltar 'phong gi slob dpon de ral gris 'debs sam /
translated: then, when that master of archery strikes with a sword

original: mda' 'phen pa na /
analyzed: mda' 'phen pa na /
translated: or shoots an arrow,

analyzed: thams cad du de gdon mi za bar byed pa ltar glang po che dang; rta dang / mi gzhan gyis bya ba de mi byed do //

original: gang po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa dang / zhe sdang spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa rnams kyi ched du go cha gyon te /
analyzed: gang po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa dang / zhe sdang spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa rnams kyi ched du go cha gyon te /
translated: Pūrṇa, in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dons the armor for the sake of those sentient beings who engage in desire, who engage in hatred, and who engage in delusion.

original: sems can de dag gi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir dang / zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir dang / gti mug spang ba'i phyir chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir dang / zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir dang / gti mug spang ba'i phyir chos kyang ston to //
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings, after attaining manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, he teaches the sacred doctrine in order to abandon desire, in order to abandon hatred, and in order to abandon delusion.

original: gang po / des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang po / des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa yin no //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nam yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nam yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: ” He replied, “Blessed One, according to my understanding of the meaning of what you have said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as never being in a state of non-equipoise.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa na'ang mnyam par gzhag par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: “Lord, a bodhisattva great being should be known as equipoised when standing in the perfection of giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @113b brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @113b brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: A bodhisattva great being should be known as equipoised when standing in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa na'ang mnyam par gzhag par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa na'ang mnyam par gzhag par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: dper bgyi na /
analyzed: dper bgyi na /
translated: for example,

analyzed: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ni gser gyi snod du bzhag na'ang /
translated: a precious sapphire placed in a golden vessel

analyzed: rin po che'i rang bzhin mi 'dor la /

analyzed: de bzhin du dngul gyi snod dang / shel gyi snod dang / lcags kyi snod du bzhag na'ang rin po che'i rang bzhin mi 'dor te /

analyzed: de bzhin du kham pa'i snod dang / sa la bzhag na'ang rin po che'i rang bzhin mi 'dor lags so //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa na'ang /

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: he should be known as being in meditative equipoise.

translated: When abiding in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, he should be known as being in meditative equipoise.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal to //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal to //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: gang po / legs so //

analyzed: legs so // gang po / de de bzhin no //
translated: Pūrṇa, it is excellent!🔽Pūrṇa, it is so!

analyzed: gal te @114a *//

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pa rnams las dben pa /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings should be known to be dwelling on the level of non-equipoise.

translated: and through a single-pointed mind, attain and abide in the second concentration, which is free from conceptualization and analysis, and is characterized by joy and bliss,🔽and if, while abiding in the second concentration, they aspire to the level of the śrāvakas

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' rnam par g-yengs pa yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la gnas pa @114b yin par rig par bya'o //

original: gang po / gzhan yang /

analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la bsgrubs te gnas shing /

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la gnas pa na nyan thos kyi sa 'am /

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod par byed na /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems rnam par g-yengs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems rnam par g-yengs pa yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known to be abiding on the level of the non-equipoised.

original: gang po / gzhan yang /
analyzed: gang po / gzhan yang /

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bde ba'ang spangs /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bde ba'ang spangs /

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa /

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas shing /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas shing /
translated: “He accomplishes and abides in the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhin pa la gnas pa na nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhin pa la gnas pa na nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
translated: While abiding in the fourth concentration, if he wishes for the level of the śrāvakas

analyzed: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'am /
